title: Drawing, "Window Alcove", 1815–22
medium: Pen and black ink, watercolor on white wove paper, silhouetted
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
description:
Horizontal rectangle. Design for the Royal Pavilion, Brighton. Design for an alcove with an arched ceiling and containing a window. A lattice-work pattern on the walls. Festoons of drapery at entrance to alcove. Above the drapery, a cornice is visible with decoration of dolphins and lattice-work.

Original album associated with this collection still exists.  See 1948-40-1 accessory

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Window Alcove", 1815–22.
1815–22. Pen and black ink, watercolor on white wove paper, silhouetted. Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane. 1948-40-67.
